text: [Dinner At Eight](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_3/dinner_at_eight.html) (first meeting)
[A Mid-Winter Night's Dream](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_17/a_mid_winter_nights_dream.html)
[Kisses Sweeter Than Wine](/frasier/transcripts/season_3/episode_5/kisses_sweeter_than_wine.html)
[Moon Dance](/frasier/transcripts/season_3/episode_13/moon_dance.html) (The "Tango" Episode)
[Mixed Doubles](/frasier/transcripts/season_4/episode_6/mixed_doubles.html)
[Daphne Hates Sherry](/frasier/transcripts/season_4/episode_21/daphne_hates_sherry.html) (Almost slept together)

[Visions Of Daphne](/frasier/transcripts/season_6/episode_22/visions_of_daphne.html) (He almost lost her forever)
[Back Talk [1]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_10/back_talk_1.html) (She found out The Secret)
[The Fight Before Christmas [2]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_11/the_fight_before_christmas_2.html)
[Dark Side Of The Moon](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_22/dark_side_of_the_moon.html)
[Something Borrowed, Someone Blue [1]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_23/something_borrowed_someone_blue_1.html)
[Something Borrowed, Someone Blue [2]](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_24/something_borrowed_someone_blue_2.html) (They found each other)
[And The Dish Ran Away With The Spoon [1]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_1/and_the_dish_ran_away_with_the_spoon_1.html)
[And The Dish Ran Away With The Spoon [2]](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_2/and_the_dish_ran_away_with_the_spoon_2.html)
[Taking Liberties](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_5/taking_liberties.html)

[Daphne Returns](/frasier/transcripts/season_8/episode_19/daphne_returns.html) (Weight loss, and Consummation)
[The First Temptation of Daphne](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_3/the_first_temptation_of_daphne.html)
[Mother Load [1]](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_12/mother_load_1.html)
[Mother Load [2]](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_13/mother_load_2.html)
[The Proposal](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_15/the_proposal.html) (For real this time)

[Moons Over Seattle](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_24/moons_over_seattle.html) (Off we go!)   * * *  ## Mum    Gertrude Moon has appeared in the following episodes: [[7.24](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_24/something_borrowed_someone_blue_2.html)] Something Borrowed, Someone Blue [2] [[9.12](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_12/mother_load_1.html)] Mother Load [1] [[9.13](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_13/mother_load_2.html)] Mother Load [2] [[9.15](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_15/the_proposal.html)] The Proposal [[9.23](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_23/the_guilt_trippers.html)] The Guilt Trippers [[9.24](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_24/moons_over_seattle.html)] Moons Over Seattle [[10.1](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_1/the_ring_cycle.html)] The Ring Cycle [[10.5](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_5/tales_from_the_crypt.htmll)] Tales From the Crypt [[10.9](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_9/dont_go_breaking_my_heart_3.html)] Don't Go Breaking My Heart [3] [[10.13](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_13/lilith_needs_a_favor.html)] Lilith Needs A Favor [[10.14](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_14/daphne_does_dinner.html)] Daphne Does Dinner [[10.16](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_16/fraternal_schwinns.html)] Fraternal Schwinns [[10.19](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_19/some_assembly_required.html)] Some Assembly Required   * * *  ## Transcript {David Langley}     Act 1  Scene 1 - Wedding Chapel  [_Fade in.  Niles and Daphne are preparing to take their vows._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I, Daphne Moon, do take thee, Niles Crane, as my husband.  I promise you my fidelity and my support, my laughter and my tears, my constant friendship and my unending love as long as we both shall live.

speaker: Niles
text: I, Niles Crane, do take thee, Daphne Moon, as my wife.  I vow to you my fidelity and my support, my honor and my respect, my honesty and my protection.  You are my comfort, my joy, and my one true love.  I will cherish you all the days of my life and treasure the journey that has brought us to this most wonderful perfect place.  [_The scene shifts to show a leisure suited official with a sign behind him saying "Lucky 7"_]  [_N.B. The Officiant is played by writer Sam Johnson._]

speaker: Officiant
text: For most folks that's one too many free cocktails, am I right?  [_They give him looks that are less than enthused._]

speaker: Officiant
text: Seriously, do you have the rings?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no.  In my rush to get here, I completely forgot about them.

speaker: Daphne
text: Does this mean we can't get married?

speaker: Officiant
text: It would, if we didn't offer seven different wedding band packages for you to choose from.  [_He pulls a tray from beneath the podium._] Now, depending on your budget, we can offer you anything from the "B-Steel My Heart", that's genuine stainless right there, to the "Never Ending Love", which can be returned for up to ninety days, no questions asked.

speaker: Daphne
text: They do seem the nicest.  [_Her cell phone rings._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, damn, who could be calling at this hour?  [_She goes to answer the phone as Niles checks the ring._]

speaker: Niles
text: Wow, you certainly don't see six and a half karat gold every day.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello?  [_Cut to - Roz in her bedroom.  The camera switches back and forth to focus on each woman as she speaks._]

speaker: Roz
text: Daphne, it's Roz.  Quick, turn on your TV.  My building's on the news.

speaker: Daphne
text: What?

speaker: Roz
text: Some murder/suicide thing, I'm gonna wave to you from my balcony.

speaker: Daphne
text: Darn, I'm not home.

speaker: Roz
text: Where are you?

speaker: Daphne
text: You're not going to believe this, but Niles and I flew to Reno and we're getting married right now!  [_The official runs Niles card through an imprinter for the rings._]

speaker: Roz
text: You are not!

speaker: Daphne
text: I am so!  [_The scene cuts back and forth between them as they squeal in excitement and delight. Niles signs the receipt._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Officiant_] Apparently it's some sort of dolphin emergency.

speaker: Daphne
text: I should go.  I'll tell you everything when we get back.  Okay, bye.  [_She hangs up the phone.  Back in Seattle, Roz does the same, then makes a disturbed noise when she sees the latest development on TV.  Cut to - Daphne returning to the podium._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Sorry.

speaker: Officiant
text: You may exchange rings as a symbol of the promises you've made here today.  [_Niles and Daphne put the rings on each other's fingers._]

speaker: Officiant
text: By the power vested in me by the state of Nevada, county of Washoe and the all-new Lucky 7 Resort and Casino, I now pronounce you Husband and Wife.  Good luck!  [_He hits a switch and the recorded sounds of church bells are heard.  He starts to leave, but pauses at the chapel door._]

speaker: Officiant
text: Hey, don't forget to check out our topless buffet.  [_He heads out.  Niles turns to Daphne and has to raise his voice to be heard over the bells._]

speaker: Niles
text: He never said "You may kiss the bride."

speaker: Daphne
text: You may kiss the bride.  [_They embrace and kiss.   Fade out._]  **BLAME IT ON RENO**  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment  [_Fade in.  Frasier is getting ready to head out the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Chop, chop, Dad!  Let's get a move on!  The last time I was late for the farmer's market, I got the worst of the squash blossoms.  [_Martin comes in from the kitchen in his security uniform, carrying a bag._]

speaker: Martin
text: [_muttering_]  Oh, whatever shall we serve the Duchess?

speaker: Frasier
text: What?!

speaker: Martin
text: I said "I'm coming."  And it's not my fault I'm late, it's Daphne's. I don't know where she is, I had to make my own lunch.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear lord, give it here.  [_He grabs the bag from Martin and looks in it._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Two bags of chips, three puddin' cups, and a root beer.

speaker: Martin
text: What's wrong with that?

speaker: Frasier
text: A, this is not a lunch, and B, I fail to see how it took you so long since you did not make anything but simply transferred smaller containers into a larger one.  Let's go!  [_He grabs his keys and opens the door to reveal Niles and Daphne._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, hello all.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi.  [_They hurry in, excited._]

speaker: Martin
text: Where have you been?  I had to make my own lunch.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_exasperated_]  Oh...

speaker: Daphne
text: We've got some big news.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, um, maybe they should sit down.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's going on?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, last night, I told Niles that I wanted to marry him right then and there.

speaker: Niles
text: And once I realized she was serious, we rushed out into the night, fully intending to.

speaker: Daphne
text: But then we found out that in Washington, it takes three days to get a marriage license.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank goodness.

speaker: Niles
text: Why?

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?!  If we had missed your wedding, well it would have just killed me.

speaker: Niles
text: It would've?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well of course it would.  Niles, we've been there through the last ten tortured years of your courtship.  How could we not be hurt if we missed the wedding?

speaker: Niles
text: But surely you could understand if, if someone were carried away by their emotions...

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm just glad it turned out the way that it did, because it would've just broken my heart.  [_Niles and Daphne stand there with slightly guilty looks as, behind their backs, they slip off the wedding rings._]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we didn't come here to break anyone's heart.  We came here to tell you that there's a wedding in three days!

speaker: Daphne
text: Isn't that big news?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, we're going to have a simple ceremony at the courthouse.

speaker: Frasier
text: That is just wonderful!  And you know what?  By way of a celebration, please allow me to treat us all to dinner at Couer du Singe.  How does that sound, eh?

speaker: Daphne
text: That sounds wonderful.  [_The doorbell rings and Martin answers it to reveal Roz walking Ariel._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, how ya doin'?

speaker: Roz
text: You want to go to the dog park?  [_she notices Niles and Daphne_]  Oh, my God! You guys are here!  [_She rushes over to hug Daphne shouting for joy._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm here too.

speaker: Niles
text: Um, we were just talking about our wedding.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, good, I want to hear all about it.

speaker: Daphne
text: We're going to have a small civil ceremony on Friday.  [_Roz starts one of her excited squeals that turns into a "huh?" sound as this sinks in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, if you'll excuse me, I'm in a rush to get to the farmer's market.

speaker: Niles
text: At this hour?  I hope you like listless radicchio.  [_Frasier hurries Martin out the door._]

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, what the hell?  I thought you guys got married in Reno.  [_Daphne and Niles go to sit on the couch as Roz sits in Martin's chair._]

speaker: Daphne
text: We did.  But as we were trying to tell Mr. Crane and Dr. Crane, they told us how hurt they'd be if we got married without them.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, which, in the moment, failed to occur to us.  So, to spare their feelings, we're having a fake wedding on Friday.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, that works for me, because Alice is still counting on being a flower girl.

speaker: Niles
text: Of course.

speaker: Daphne
text: Great.

speaker: Roz
text: So if you guys have two weddings, when's your anniversary going to be?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, to keep up appearances, I suppose it'll have to be the second one, won't it?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we could celebrate two anniversaries.  A public one, and then a second, secret one just for us.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I like that.  Sort of sexy having an anniversary only two of us know about.

speaker: Roz
text: Three of us.

speaker: Niles
text: I still can't believe we're married.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's our one-day anniversary.

speaker: Roz
text: And we're the only ones who know.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, we should celebrate.

speaker: Niles
text: How about going to the dog park?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that doesn't sound very romantic.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not talking to you.  [_Roz gets the hint and leaves with Ariel as Niles and Daphne fall into each other's arms.  Fade out._]  Scene 3 - The Courthouse  [_Fade in.  Niles and Daphne are waiting at the door to a judge's chambers where Martin and Frasier are setting up the wedding._]

speaker: Niles
text: Nervous?

speaker: Daphne
text: Less than last time.  I guess it helps to have had a rehearsal.

speaker: Niles
text: It wasn't a rehearsal, it was the real thing.  This is just a... touring company performance.

speaker: Daphne
text: Right.  [_They kiss and go in as Roz, Alice and Gertrude Moon come up the hallway._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: It's a bloody miracle we're here in one piece what with the way you drive.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm better at it when someone's not screaming in my ear.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Well, in my day people didn't drive so recklessly.  Do you know why?

speaker: Alice
text: Is it because you rode dinosaurs?  [_Roz bites her lips to keep from smiling._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: You should talk to your daughter.  [_She goes into the judge's chambers and Roz hunkers down._]

speaker: Roz
text: When we get home, you're getting ice cream.  [_They go in as well.  Cut to - the judge's chambers._]

speaker: Frasier
text: We're all here, your honor.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Why did we all have to be here just to pick up a bloody license? Couldn't we have met at the church?

speaker: Daphne
text: Mum, we're not going to the church, we're getting married here.

speaker: Gertrude
text: You're what?

speaker: Niles
text: We're having a civil ceremony.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Without a minister?  Out of the question.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mum...

speaker: Gertrude
text: That's enough, Daphne.  I am your mother and I will not bear witness to a Godless union.

speaker: Martin
text: Gertrude, I was in favor of a church wedding too, but this is their day, not ours.  Maybe we should just let them decide how it's gonna be.

speaker: Gertrude
text: If people got to decide things for themselves, no one would go to church.  [_The Judge, whose name is Anderson, rises._]

speaker: Anderson
text: If I may...

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll handle this, Your Honor.  Mrs. Moon, you have my personal guarantee that this will not be a Godless union.  For if you truly believe in the omniscience and omnipresence of the Lord, then surely are we not always in His presence?

speaker: Gertrude
text: No, He lives at the church.  All I'm asking is that you honor the wishes of an old woman, whose every child has been married by a minister, or at least a prison chaplain.

speaker: Niles
text: Perhaps, given the depth of feeling here, it would be best to wait.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I suppose we could find a church in reasonably short order.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't believe this.

speaker: Anderson
text: If you're not going to get married now, perhaps you could all take this out into the hall?  I have a schedule to keep.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Roz, take me home.  [_She makes an exasperated noise._]

speaker: Niles
text: We'll call you when we've cleared this all up.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, let's go, Alice.  [_She opens the door.  Alice flings a handful of flower petals on the floor._]

speaker: Alice
text: Congratulations.  [_Roz and Alice leave, Gertrude pauses at the door._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: When you're prepared to have a proper wedding, you know where to find me.  [_She heads out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: That we do!  On your fiery throne presiding over the damned!  All right, lets-let's go.

speaker: Martin
text: [_as they leave_]  Where are we gonna find a clergyman who'll perform on such short notice?  [_Cut to - the hallway._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, maybe the judge knows somebody.  Hang on a second here.  Your honor...  [_He and Martin head back in._]

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, Daphne.  But it'll just be a few days, and then we can be married.

speaker: Daphne
text: We already are.  This is supposed to be the happiest time of my life. I want to wear my wedding ring.  I'm Mrs. Niles Crane and I don't want to keep it a secret.

speaker: Niles
text: You just want to tell them the truth?

speaker: Daphne
text: Too complicated.  Let's just get married again.  [_She takes his hand and pulls him into the judge's chambers.  Cut to - the chambers as the hurry in._]

speaker: Niles
text: The wedding's on.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  What about Mrs. Moon?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry she'll miss it, but that's her choice.  Your honor, we've changed our minds, we want to be married.  [_Everyone hurries into place._]

speaker: Anderson
text: All right, but we have to be quick about this.  Are we ready to begin?

speaker: Niles
text: [_together with Daphne_]  Yes.

speaker: Anderson
text: Okay, let's do it.  Daphne, please repeat after me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Actually,  we've written our own vows.

speaker: Anderson
text: Of course you have.

speaker: Daphne
text: I, Daphne Moon, do take thee, Niles Crane, as my husband.  I promise you my fidelity and my support, my laughter and my tears...  [_As she continues, Frasier begins sobbing._]

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, you said you wouldn't do this!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_blubbering_]  I say a lot of things.  [_Martin looks a little peeved, the ceremony continues.  Fade out._]  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Frasier's Apartment  [_Fade in.  Martin, Frasier, Niles and Daphne come in after the celebration dinner._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Frasier, thank you so much for dinner.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, it was wonderful.

speaker: Frasier
text: It was my pleasure.  Dad, don't you have something to add?

speaker: Martin
text: [_as he sits_]  I already said thank you for dinner.  What am I supposed to do, get down on my knees and kowtow to your fancy-ass American Express card?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I was referring to the gift we have for them.

speaker: Martin
text: [_clambering to his feet_]  Oh!  Right, I forgot about that.  Yeah, and thanks for dinner, Fraizh, it really was excellent.  I didn't think I'd like beef cheeks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes!  Dad, give them the gift.  [_Martin carries a box over to the couch._]

speaker: Daphne
text: This is so exciting, our first wedding present.  [_Niles opens it._]

speaker: Daphne
text: It's a silver picture frame!

speaker: Niles
text: Beautiful.

speaker: Frasier
text: And nota bene, it's been engraved with today's date in order to commemorate your wedding date until your real gift arrives.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's very sweet.  Thank you Mr. Crane and Dr. Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: You can't call us that anymore, we're family now.

speaker: Daphne
text: So we are.  Well, thank you... Frasier.  Oh, that feels strange.  [_She and Martin rise._]

speaker: Daphne
text: And thank you...  [_He prompts her with "Dad" just as she says "Martin"._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Or Martin.  Whatever makes you feel comfortable.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank you Mr. Crane.

speaker: Martin
text: Don't mention it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I better go and figure out what to pack for the honeymoon.  [_She kisses Niles and heads for her room.  Martin rests on the arm of his chair and Niles sits down smugly._]

speaker: Niles
text: I'm just bringing sun screen.  [_Frasier rises and walks to the kitchen._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Pardon me.  I have to go and poke out my mind's eye.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you're lucky.  I always wanted to go to Bora Bora.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it's going to be fantastic, Dad.  We're staying in a thatched hut built out over the water.  In the middle of the floor there's a window where you can look straight down to the bottom of the ocean.

speaker: Martin
text: [_rising_]  Well, I hope it's not too deep.  When we went to the top of the Space Needle and you looked down, you got sick.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: All over that poor Japanese tour group.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: And when I yelled down to warn them, they just looked up.  [_He leaves to his room.  The doorbell rings and Niles gets up to answer it._]

speaker: Niles
text: That was three years ago!  [_He opens the door and Gertrude comes in._]

speaker: Niles
text: Mrs. Moon.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Did you find a minister yet?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, no.  Actually...  [_Daphne comes in from her room._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Good, then I'm not too late.

speaker: Daphne
text: Too late for what?

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, Daphne.  When I got home this afternoon, well, I was openin' a bottle of scotch to have with me tea and I began thinking.  I was married by a minister in a church and, and what's it got me?  Alone and unloved is what. And likely because I've been such a rotten mother to you all these years.

speaker: Daphne
text: You haven't been rotten.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Oh, yes I have.  On what should have been the happiest day of your life, I thought of only myself.  I'm ashamed.  I mean I'm embarrassed and I apologize.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, mum.  [_They tearfully hug._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: My only solace is you aren't married yet.  Because if I miss my baby's wedding, I won't be able to live with myself.  [_She takes their hands, each giving her their right and hiding the left behind their backs._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Daphne, Niles you get married anywhere you want to.  All that matters is that I'm there to share it with you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, of course you'll be there.  [_They hug again.  Niles takes off his ring and puts it in his pocket and reaches out to take Daphne's as she slips it off.  Niles hides the wedding present under a sofa cushion._]

speaker: Daphne
text: We'll go right back to that courthouse tomorrow and resume where we left off.  [_Frasier comes back from the kitchen._]

speaker: Gertrude
text: Nothing could make me happier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Mrs. Moon, I see you've made peace with the wedding.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, Mrs. Moon has rescinded her ultimatum, so we're having the wedding tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah!  Niles, may I have a word with you?

speaker: Niles
text: Mm-hm.  Excuse me.  [_The go into the kitchen.  Cut to - the kitchen as the enter._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell's going on?  You guys already got married.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but she doesn't know that.  So, tomorrow we're going to have another ceremony for her benefit.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's crazy!

speaker: Niles
text: It may be, but I'm afraid the truth would crush her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please!  All the wine presses in Bordeaux wouldn't crush that woman. Niles, what you and Daphne shared today was utterly unique.

speaker: Niles
text: You think so?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it was a singular moment.  Anyone fooled by a repeat performance would have to be a complete imbecile.

speaker: Niles
text: True.  But, if it's what Daphne wants, I'll support her.  We'll get Roz back, we'll find a different judge and we'll just do it all over again. And, it'll be just as perfect as today's was.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine.  But I'm not singing "Wonderful World" again.

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe more perfect.  [_He walks out on an irritated Frasier.  Fade to -_]  Scene 2  [_Niles and Daphne sitting on a bench at the courthouse._]

speaker: Niles
text: Remember how excited we were at our first wedding?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, we were both shaking.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, I noticed the first time you promised me your honesty and protection, but not the second time.

speaker: Niles
text: No, because I vowed to always be true and to be your constant champion. It's the same thing.

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose.

speaker: Niles
text: You liked it better the first way.  [_She nods._]  Okay, we can go back to that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thanks.

speaker: Niles
text: You making any changes?

speaker: Daphne
text: Nope, same old, same old.  [_Roz comes down the hall with a bouquet humming the wedding march, followed by Gertrude, Martin and Frasier.  Niles and Daphne rise._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Where's Alice?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, upset stomach.  On the way home yesterday she snacked on the leftover petals in her basket.  So, I'm sorry, but I won't be able to join you for dinner.

speaker: Niles
text: We understand.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Explain it to me then.  What sort of child eats roses?  'Tisn't normal.

speaker: Roz
text: You could have stopped her you know.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Not the way she was noshing them up, I couldn't.  Like a wood chipper she was.

speaker: Roz
text: All right.

speaker: Gertrude
text: The incredible beaver baby.

speaker: Roz
text: We GET it!  [_Donny Douglas comes around the corner with a woman._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear lord, is that... Donny?  Everybody, look at your shoes!  [_They all look down, but Donny notices them._]

speaker: Donny
text: Wait a minute, Daph... is that Daphne?  [_Everybody looks back up._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Donny?

speaker: Donny
text: Hey.

speaker: Daphne
text: What a surprise.

speaker: Donny
text: Everybody.  Boy, I hope this isn't uncomfortable.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, not at all.  Say, is that a drinking fountain over there?

speaker: Martin
text: Sure looks like one.  [_Everybody but Niles and Daphne rush back don the hall._]

speaker: Donny
text: Well, Niles, Daphne, I'd like you to meet Bridgett, my fiancee.

speaker: Bridgett
text: Hi.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Bridgett
text: We just filed for a marriage license.

speaker: Niles
text: Congratulations.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's great.

speaker: Donny
text: Thank you.  I know that I was getting married the last time you ran into me, but this time I found the real thing.

speaker: Daphne
text: Good, I'm glad.

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah.  You know, if you hadn't left me I never would have met my ex-wife who introduced me to Bridgett, so, in a weird way, you played a big part in my eventual happiness.

speaker: Niles
text: That's a very healthy perspective.

speaker: Donny
text: I think so too.  So, what are you guys doing here?

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles and I are getting married.

speaker: Donny
text: Well, congratulations.  That is great.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you.  [_He shakes Niles' hand and gives Daphne a hug._]

speaker: Donny
text: Well, it's great.  It's nice seeing you and I hope you'll come to our wedding.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, same here.

speaker: Donny
text: Really?  You'd be okay with that?  [_Daphne and Niles are a little taken aback, but forge on._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, sure, why not?

speaker: Niles
text: Of course, it's anybody's guess how long we could be waiting here.  [_The door to the judge's chambers open and Judge Stern steps out._]

speaker: Stern
text: You can come in now.

speaker: Niles
text: Who had one second?  Everyone, it's time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, here we go then.  [_The others all file back down the hall.  Donny introduces Bridgett to them and they all go in.  Cut to - the chambers as they all assemble._]

speaker: Stern
text: Is this everybody?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Stern
text: Let's get started.  We come here today to unite this man and this woman in marriage.  I understand Daphne and Niles have composed vows that are especially significant to them.  Niles.  [_Niles takes her hands and begins to recite, somewhat uncertainly._]

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, I, Niles Crane take you, Daphne Moon, to be my wife.  I, I vow to you my, my fidelity and support, honor, respect, uh, honesty, protection, and... support...you are my comfort and joy and, oh, shoot, there's one more...

speaker: Daphne
text: One true love.

speaker: Niles
text: One true love!  That's right.  Okay, you go.

speaker: Daphne
text: "Okay, you go"?  I, Daphne Moon, do...  I'm sorry, this is wrong.  I can't stand here and rattle off a bunch of words that don't mean anything anymore. I can't go through with this.

speaker: Donny
text: YES!  I KNEW IT!  [_pointing at Niles_]  Now you know what it's like to have the love of your life dump you at the altar!  And good luck trying to find somebody as good, because she just ain't out there!  [_He turns around to find Bridgett staring at him in horror._]

speaker: Donny
text: What?  [_She rushes out and he hurries after her._]

speaker: Donny
text: No, no.  Bridgett, Bridgett! [_exits_]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry everyone, but Niles and I, we're already married.

speaker: Gertrude
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Mrs. Moon, I'm afraid it's true.  Niles and Daphne are already married, and they were simply trying to spare your feelings.

speaker: Roz
text: You knew about Reno?

speaker: Frasier
text: I was talking about yesterday.  What happened in Reno?

speaker: Roz
text: They got married yesterday?

speaker: Gertrude
text: This is all a lie?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, yesterday was a lie.  We eloped last week.

speaker: Martin
text: I thought you had to wait for the license.

speaker: Niles
text: That's why we went to Reno.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why didn't you tell us?

speaker: Niles
text: We thought you'd be insulted.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm insulted now!  How could you tell Roz and not tell your family?

speaker: Gertrude
text: How could you have two weddings without telling your mother about one?

speaker: Roz
text: How could you cheat Alice out of being a flower girl?

speaker: Daphne
text: We just wanted to be married.

speaker: Martin
text: Hold on, I got a question here.  [_He opens the door._]

speaker: Martin
text: You've been married for a week, how come you're not on your honeymoon?

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you...Martin.  [_Niles and Daphne go to the door._]

speaker: Niles
text: I hope you can all forgive us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, your happiness that's what's important.

speaker: Gertrude
text: This is such a relief.

speaker: Daphne
text: It just felt wrong to start off a  marriage with a lie.

speaker: Gertrude
text: Um, was the first one at least in front of a minister?

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, let's go.  [_They leave.  Fade out._]
